title: SB 1288 - Public Schools AI Working Group
description: Establishes an AI working group to develop guidance and model policy for safe, equitable AI use in California public schools.
summary_text: Directs the Superintendent of Public Instruction to convene a working group, with at least half being current classroom teachers, to develop guidance on safe AI use in schools by January 2026 and a model policy by July 2026.

title: HB 3851 - AI Deepfake Cyberbullying in Schools
description: Expands the definition of cyberbullying to include AI-generated deepfake content shared without consent.
summary_text: Amends the School Code to expand the definition of cyberbullying to include posting or sharing a person's AI-generated digital replica online without permission if it causes harm. Takes effect for the 2026-2027 school year.

title: Executive Order on Advancing AI Education for American Youth
description: President Trump's executive order to integrate AI education into K-12 classrooms nationwide.
summary_text: Promotes AI literacy by integrating AI into K-12 education, providing comprehensive AI training for educators, and fostering early exposure to AI concepts. Establishes White House Task Force on AI Education and Presidential AI Challenge for youth.

title: HB 487 - Computer Science and AI Graduation Requirement
description: Makes computer science including AI concepts a high school graduation requirement in Georgia.
summary_text: Requires a computer science course as a high school graduation requirement beginning in 2031. Course standards include AI concepts, preparing students for technology-driven careers.

title: SB 1711 - AI Policies in Education (Public Chapter 550)
description: Requires all Tennessee school districts, charter schools, and public universities to adopt AI use policies.
summary_text: Requires each local board of education, charter school governing body, and public higher education institution to adopt policies regarding AI technology use by students, teachers, faculty, and staff for instructional and assignment purposes. Tennessee is the only state mandating district-level AI rules.

title: HB 531 - AI Literacy Instruction
description: Requires age-appropriate AI instruction in Tennessee schools and professional development for educators.
summary_text: Requires local education agencies and public charter schools to provide age-appropriate instruction on accessing, utilizing, and critically evaluating AI tools. Requires the Department of Education to issue implementation guidance and provide AI professional development programs.

title: AB 406 - AI in Schools Mental Health Services
description: Prohibits use of AI to replace school counselors, psychologists, and social workers in Nevada public schools.
summary_text: Prohibits the use of AI in public schools for counselors, psychologists, or social workers, except for administrative efficiencies. Requires the Department of Education to develop guidance for mental health professionals on responsible AI use in student services.

title: SB 2426 - AI Task Force
description: Creates the Artificial Intelligence Regulation Task Force to study AI technologies including education applications.
summary_text: Establishes the Artificial Intelligence Regulation (AIR) Task Force with seven voting members including legislative and agency representatives, plus expert ex-officio members from education, healthcare, and technology. Must report findings annually; dissolves December 31, 2027.

title: HB 332 - Computer Science and AI Graduation Requirement
description: Requires completion of a computer science course including AI concepts for high school graduation in Alabama.
summary_text: Beginning with the graduating class of 2031, requires all public school students to earn at least one computer science course credit including AI, coding, and quantum computing for graduation. Passed the Alabama House.

title: HB 1391 - AI in K-12 Education
description: Mandates the Maryland State Department of Education to develop AI guidance and approved AI tools for classrooms.
summary_text: Requires MSDE to develop and update guidance on AI use in education, create a list of approved AI tools for classroom use, and establish a task force to study AI's implications in K-12 education.

title: Executive Order 01.01.2024.02 - AI in State Government
description: Governor Moore's executive order catalyzing responsible and productive AI use in Maryland state government.
summary_text: Establishes framework for responsible AI use across Maryland state agencies including education. Directs agencies to develop AI use policies and identify beneficial AI applications while managing risks.

title: HB 2 - Education Data Governance and AI Working Group
description: Directs creation of an education data governance and AI working group within the legislative education study committee.
summary_text: Directs the legislative education study committee to create an education data governance and AI working group to study and recommend structures for improved statewide education data governance and policies addressing AI in education.

title: Executive Order 24-01 - Artificial Intelligence
description: Washington state executive order establishing AI governance framework including education workforce assessment.
summary_text: Directs assessment of generative AI's impact on the state workforce and identifies research opportunities and partnerships with institutions to power innovation and expansion of AI technology and education.

title: Executive Order 2024-12 - AI Task Force
description: Maine executive order establishing an AI task force to study AI impacts across state functions including education.
summary_text: Creates an AI task force to study AI impacts and develop recommendations for responsible use across state agencies. Led to the Department of Education releasing an AI guidance toolkit in February 2025.

title: Governor's AI Task Force
description: Arkansas governor established an AI task force that released an initial report with education recommendations.
summary_text: Established a task force to comprehensively study AI across state functions. Released initial report with recommendations on risk management, phased policy development, AI literacy curriculum frameworks, and educator professional development.

title: Alaska K12 AI Framework
description: Alaska Department of Education comprehensive guidance on responsible AI integration in K-12 schools.
summary_text: Comprehensive guidance on responsible AI integration in K-12 education, focusing on augmenting human capabilities while maintaining ethical and responsible use practices.

title: Generative AI in the Classroom Guidance
description: Delaware guidance on understanding, implementing, and integrating generative AI in K-12 classrooms.
summary_text: Provides guidance on understanding AI, classroom implementation, and professional learning. Published by the Delaware Council on Educational Technology to support educators in integrating generative AI responsibly.

title: AI Guidance for Education
description: Hawaii Department of Education guidance on ethical and responsible AI use in schools.
summary_text: Establishes a balanced approach to AI in education with emphasis on ethical considerations and a framework for responsible use by students and educators across Hawaii's public schools.

title: AI Guidance for Education
description: Kentucky Department of Education AI guidance promoting consistency in technology integration.
summary_text: Provides guidance on consistent technology integration with a balanced approach to AI in education. Promotes normalization of responsible AI use across Kentucky schools.

title: Comprehensive AI Guide for K-12 Schools
description: Louisiana Department of Education comprehensive AI guidance covering classroom integration and safeguards.
summary_text: Comprehensive guide covering AI overview, challenges, plagiarism and cheating mitigation strategies, classroom integration approaches, and safeguards for student data. Published following the state AI Task Force recommendations.

title: AI Guidance for Education
description: Missouri Department of Education AI guidance covering capabilities, professional development, and data privacy.
summary_text: Covers AI capabilities and limitations, professional development recommendations, instructional practices, and data privacy considerations for Missouri schools.

title: Montana AI in K12 Education Guidelines
description: Montana Department of Education human-centered approach guidelines for AI in K-12 education.
summary_text: Establishes a human-centered approach to AI in education with core principles addressing benefits, risks, professional learning needs, and accessibility considerations.

title: K-12 AI Guidance Framework
description: North Dakota guidance framework for AI policy development in K-12 schools.
summary_text: Provides a framework to guide K-12 schools in developing AI policies and implementation strategies for responsible AI integration in North Dakota.

title: AI Guidance for Education
description: Oklahoma Department of Education guidance on understanding AI, benefits, risks, and academic integrity.
summary_text: Addresses understanding AI, benefits and risks, roles and responsibilities, academic integrity considerations, and implementation guidance for Oklahoma schools.

title: AI Guidance for Education
description: Rhode Island guidance on AI instructional practices, equity, and college/career readiness.
summary_text: Provides instructional guidance addressing equity and bias, support for diverse learners, security considerations, and preparation for college and career readiness in an AI-driven world.

title: AI Standards Framework for K-12
description: South Carolina AI standards framework for career and technical education including AI curriculum.
summary_text: Establishes curriculum standards and course framework for teaching AI concepts in K-12 career and technical education. One of the first states to develop dedicated AI curriculum standards.

title: AI Guidance for Education
description: West Virginia Department of Education guidance on AI use across school roles and risk management.
summary_text: Addresses AI use for users in various school roles including classroom instruction, school administration, and risk management considerations for West Virginia schools.

title: Guidance for AI Use Policy in Schools
description: Wyoming Department of Education guidance for school districts on developing AI use policies.
summary_text: Provides guidelines for Wyoming school districts on developing AI use policies, focusing on appropriate and responsible AI use and academic integrity.

title: AI Guidance and Planning Framework for Schools
description: Michigan comprehensive AI guidance and planning framework for K-12 school districts.
summary_text: Comprehensive AI integration framework developed by Michigan Virtual in partnership with the Michigan Department of Education. Covers eight key areas including data compliance, ethical use, plagiarism, data privacy, informed consent, and algorithmic transparency for K-12 educators.

title: GenAI Guidance for K-12 Schools
description: Arizona generative AI guidance providing direction for effective and responsible AI implementation in schools.
summary_text: Developed by the Arizona Institute for Education and the Economy at Northern Arizona University. Provides guidance on teaching and learning with generative AI, administrator and school system use, and ethical considerations for educators.
